titleStmt.title: A. J. Scott et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5232

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramblett
Governor o the Commonwealth of Ky

Your Petitioner James W Womack would respectfully represent that he Stands indicted in the Carter Circuit Court for the Murder of Thos OBrien, he would represent that OBrien was a reckless drunken dangerous man, and on Several Ocasions had threatened to kill your Petitioner, and your Petitioner for days had absented himself from his home to avoid a difficulty and at Last upon the Evening of the unfortunate occurrence while in his own house he was assaulted by the Deceased, and in his necessary Self defence was compelled to Shoot him. Your Petitioner would say that he is young and poor and this is the only difficulty that he ever had in his life and he prays your Excellency to grant him a pardon
We the Undersigned Citizens of Carter who are acquainted with the circumstances Join in the prayer of the foregoing Petition and reccomend this as a fit case for the interposition of the Executive

A. J. Scott
Henry Gee
Henry Scott
R M Jones
Will Kibley
